That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..even the worst movie.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to My Life Is a Mess, your other film. Either way, I have to say that your parody was pretty funny, I especially enjoyed the park bench scene, so seamless and so humorous. I enjoy the Hello Betty segment. What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Hunting Worlds. STOCKART: Space Toledo: Alien Astronaut Station! The League has offered a bounty for wanted criminals. The bounty is paid by an electronic sort of chain letter system.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little action and that the action it does have, is poorly choreographed and embarrassingly low budget, and there is some truth to those arguments, but the film is so fun and uplifting that you quickly forgive its faults.
